p: The work by Ngnameko et al., likewise covers the possibility offered by natural sources for the identification of bioactive molecules by reporting on the medicinal properties of Spathodea campanulata P. Beauv. (Bignoniaceae) [ 8]. The work shows preliminary evidence on the ability of the crude plant extract to inhibit Helicobacter pylori growth by urease inhibition and modulation of virulence factors. Fractions and subfractions of the plant crude extract were characterized by ultrahigh-performance liquid chromatography and high-resolution mass spectrometry (UHPLCâ€“HRMS). Kaempferol, a flavonol, was identified as a promising compound. Further investigations are ongoing to confirm the capacity of this new hit to modulate H. pylori virulence factors.
